summary: This is an email from a prosecutor in the Southern District of New York transmitting a government request for redactions to filings related to Ghislaine Maxwell's Rule 17(c) subpoena application in her criminal case. It includes attachments with proposed redactions to filings from defense counsel and the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Appears as the primary recipient of an email from a prosecutor regarding redaction requests in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: NYSD Chambers
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (likely the judge's chambers) of an email regarding procedural redaction requests in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, submitting the government's proposed redactions to filings in the Maxwell case on behalf of the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Government Submits Redaction Request
events.description: The government files a letter requesting redactions to filings regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's application for a Rule 17(c) subpoena.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a procedural email from a prosecutor in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case (US v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330).
The government is requesting redactions to filings related to Maxwell's Rule 17(c) subpoena application.
The proposed redactions apply to filings from defense counsel and the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP.
The correspondence indicates ongoing litigation over the scope and disclosure of information in the Maxwell case in April 2021.
